definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
"fire" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 86), occurring in 熙, 然, 熊 etc
Silver Bear, award at the Berlin International Film Festival

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it

sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor there dwelt a bear, also a boar.
sentences.chinese: 从前，在一个贫瘠的荒野里住了一只熊和一只公野猪。
他们无法想象向熊扔石头的做法。

sentences.english: And how can Santa come down our skinny little chimney?
sentences.chinese: 还有，圣诞熊怎样从我们家窄窄的小烟囱下来？

sentences.english: Julien: Kim, are there bears at the zoo?
The bear even made its way to a car dealer's lot.
sentences.chinese: 这只熊甚至在汽车供销商的地盘行走。
那将是春天中仅剩的熊吗？

sentences.english: Handsome floating commander said zhijiang bear is brother-in-law so call zhijiang.
sentences.chinese: 帅飘说之江跟熊司令是连襟于是就要去叫之江。

sentences.english: He raised his hunting spear to kill the bear.
sentences.chinese: 他举起他的矛要射死这只熊。

sentences.english: She decided to change Callisto into a bear.
sentences.chinese: 她决定变成一只熊木卫四。

sentences.english: Bear woke up with a start and pulled his long tail hard as he could.
sentences.chinese: 熊被惊醒过来，开始使劲地拉尾巴。

sentences.english: Thanks to Jeff, I'm still able to afford him.
sentences.chinese: 多亏了杰夫，让我还能养得起这熊孩子。

sentences.english: Bertha is a cute brown and white bear.
sentences.chinese: 柏莎是一只可爱的棕白相间的熊。

sentences.english: Bear also lives in this biome.
sentences.chinese: 有眼睛状花纹的熊也居住在这里。

sentences.english: Bears establish and maintain their social position and place in the hierarchy by acting aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 建立并且维持这样立体社会的等级是靠熊的暴力。

sentences.english: Anna lunges at Jack and locks her wrists behind his back in her famous bear hug.
sentences.chinese: 安娜运用她著名的熊抱把用手腕锁住了杰克的后背。

sentences.english: And bears have been duking it out for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 牛与熊之间的搏斗已经持续了几个世纪。

definition: expanse of water/ooze/(onom.) bark/classifier for liquids: pool, puddle
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
